{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Community Periodontal Index of Treatment Needs (CPITN) is a tool used to assess periodontal health and treatment needs. According to Document [1], in dental practice all teeth are examined and the highest score for each sextant is noted. Only 6 scores are recorded. This indicates that the CPITN is recorded for sextants, not quadrants, one arch, or the whole dentition.", "answer_choice": "B"}
